repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: We don't have an option (like vim's 'fixed') to truncate float screen when screen width overflows the screen.

Solution: Add `fixed` in `nvim_open_win`.

Fix https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/10811

comment_data.body: I would rephrase this as putting what the option enables upfront. something like: the position is kept fixed even if the window would be truncated.
no strlen, just `(c.border_chars[2][0] != NUL)` as width of border is always one
Why check for `w_p_wrap`? This sounds like something that should be checked by the caller that sets `fixed`.

cause vim help said there check wrap . when wrap on it will not fixed float window width on screen.

```
                         - "pos" is "botleft" or "topleft", and
                         - "wrap" is off, and
                         - the popup would be truncated at the right edge of
                           the screen, then 
```
This sounds like a completely arbitrary restriction. I don't think it makes sense.

comment_regular_data.body: Also please fix the typo in the commit message.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(float): add fixed option
